alert.note: Alert for Lee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 9:01PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Williamson, northeastern Travis, north central Bastrop and northwestern Lee Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 900 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Windemere, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Austin, Round Rock, Pflugerville, Taylor, Elgin, Lexington, Windemere, Hutto, Manor, Fedor, Tanglewood, Coupland, Knobb Springs, Rices Crossing, Blue, Beyarsville, Wells Branch, Noack, Leo and Brushy Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central Texas.
